StatusNotConnected.header1: Failed to connect to the API
StatusNotConnected.paragraph1: <0>Start an IPFS daemon in a terminal:</0>
StatusNotConnected.paragraph2: <0>For more info on how to get started with IPFS you can <1>read the guide</1>.</0>

AskToEnable.label: Help improve this app by sending anonymous usage data.

step1.title: Status page
step1.paragraph1: This is the starting point of your IPFS node and where you can check its basic info.

step2.title: Connection status
step2.paragraph1: This takes you to a page where you can check if you are connected to an IPFS daemon, and if not, how to connect to one.
step2.paragraph2: You can configure your node to with a custom API address too.

step3.title: Take a tour
step3.paragraph1: Click this button to take a tour through the current page's features and highlights.

step4.title: Node info
step4.paragraph1: Here you have information about the size of your repo, how many peers are connected, your peer ID and the IPFS flavour that's currently in use.
step4.paragraph2: <0>Click on <1>Advanced</1> to see more info such as the gateway URL and addresses.</0>

step5.title: Network bandwith
step5.paragraph1: This chart shows the network bandwith usage over time.

step6.title: Network traffic
step6.paragraph1: The speedometers show the current outgoing and incoming traffic.

step7.title: Explore
step7.paragraph1: Paste a CID and explore how that data is structured and linked across protocols.
